snippet: The first of nine defendants in a widespread Navy bribery case was sentenced Thursday to 27 months in prison for providing classified information to a Malaysian military contractor.
abstract: Petty Officer First Class Daniel Layug is sentenced to 27 months in prison for his involvement in widespread Navy bribery case; Layug is first of nine defendants who are accused of providing classified ship schedules to Malaysian military contractor Glenn Defense Marine Asia Ltd.
lead_paragraph: The first of nine defendants in a widespread Navy bribery case was sentenced Thursday to 27 months in prison for providing classified information to a Malaysian military contractor.

headline.main: California: First Sentence in Navy Bribery Case
headline.print_headline: California: First Sentence in Navy Bribery Case
